title: Acharya Nagarjuna University: Courses, Fees, Admission 2024, Placements, Cutoff
meta_description: Acharya Nagarjuna University was established in 1976 in Guntur, Andhra Pradesh. It has been accredited by NAAC with "A" Grade.
keywords: Acharya Nagarjuna University, Acharya Nagarjuna University admission, Acharya Nagarjuna University courses, Acharya Nagarjuna University fees, Acharya Nagarjuna University placement, Acharya Nagarjuna University scholarship, Acharya Nagarjuna University cutoff, Acharya Nagarjuna University facilities, Acharya Nagarjuna University colleges, Acharya Nagarjuna University ranking, ANU Guntur

basic_info.name: Acharya Nagarjuna University Courses & Fees 2024
description: Acharya Nagarjuna University offers a range of UG, PG, Ph.D. and PG Diploma courses. The university has 68 UG & PG programs and 48 Ph.D. & M.Phil programs across various disciplines. The table given below shows the Acharya Nagarjuna University Courses & Fees:

basic_info.name: Acharya Nagarjuna University Admission 2024
description: Acharya Nagarjuna University Admission 2024 is merit-based. Admission to B.Tech programs is based on JEE Mains and AP EAPCET scores. The university also accepts merit in AP EAPCET for B.Sc. and B.Pharma. Admission to the B.Arch. program is granted solely based on the candidate’s performance in NATA. To give admission in B.Tech + M.Tech, B.Des and B.Plan the university conducts an ANU Engineering Entrance Test (ANUEET). Admission to all the other UG courses is done based on merit secured in the last qualifying exams. For the PG courses, the institute conducts an Acharya Nagarjuna University Post Graduate Common Entrance Test (ANUPGCET). Admission to MBA and MCA is based on AP ICET. Interested students must visit the official website to apply for Acharya Nagarjuna University Admission.
The following documents must be submitted while applying for admission to ANU Guntur:

basic_info.name: Acharya Nagarjuna University Placement 2024
description: Acharya Nagarjuna University has a dedicated placement cell that offers good placements for UG and PG students. As per the NIRF Report 2023, a total of 326 UG students and 985 PG students were placed. The median salary offered to UG students was in a range of INR 3 LPA to INR 8 LPA and PG students were given a median package ranging from INR 3.5 LPA to INR 6.5 LPA. description: Acharya Nagarjuna University offers all the necessary facilities to students. The university campus is spread over an area of 300 acres. The library of the institute has three floors and the total area of the building is 3000 square feet. ANU Guntur is among the one of the best 16 sporting universities in the country. It has a sports hostel which can accommodate 1000 students. The institute also has a fitness and yoga centre.

faqs.question: When was Acharya Nagarjuna University established?
faqs.answer: Ans.Acharya Nagarjuna University was established in 1976 by the former President of India, Shri Fakruddin Ali Ahmed in Guntur, Andhra Pradesh. It is an affiliating university with 39 academic departments. The university has two PG centres located at Ongole (a fully self-financed centre) and another at Nuzvid (aided).

faqs.question: How are the faculties of Acharya Nagarjuna University?
faqs.answer: Ans.The faculties of Acharya Nagarjuna University are highly educated and qualified to have diverse industry experience. Each subject department has a HOD and faculties have the designation of Assistant Professor with teaching/ industry experience of more than 10 years.

faqs.question: What scholarships are offered by Acharya Nagarjuna University?
faqs.answer: Ans.Acharya Nagarjuna University offers numerous scholarships to candidates. The following scholarships can be availed by the students of ANU Guntur:Post Graduate Indira Gandhi Scholarship for Single Girl ChildMaulana Azad National Fellowship for Minority StudentsPost Graduate Merit Scholarship for University Rank HolderPost-Doctoral Fellowship to SC/ST CandidatesPost Graduate Scholarship for Professional Courses for SC/ST CandidatesMerit-based scholarship for the top 10% of students in the department

faqs.question: How are the placements at Acharya Nagarjuna University?
faqs.answer: Ans.Acharya Nagarjuna University has a dedicated placement cell that offers good placements for UG and PG students. As per the NIRF Report 2023, a total of 326 UG students and 985 PG students were placed. The median salary offered to UG students was in a range of INR 3 LPA to INR 8 LPA and PG students were given a median package ranging from INR 3.5 LPA to INR 6.5 LPA.

faqs.question: What courses are offered by Acharya Nagarjuna University?
faqs.answer: Ans.Acharya Nagarjuna University offers 68 undergraduate and postgraduate courses in the fields of Engineering, Sciences, Arts, Pharmacy, Sports and Architecture. It also provides M.Phil and Ph.D in 48 disciplines spread over six campus colleges. Some of the popular programs of ANU Guntur include B.Tech, MBA, M.Tech, PG Diploma, B.Pharm and M.Pharm.

faqs.question: What is the cutoff of Acharya Nagarjuna University?
faqs.answer: Ans.Acharya Nagarjuna University accepts AP ICET scores to offer admission to MBA and MCA programs. The overall cutoff rank for APICET is 3151 for MCA and 5247 for MBA at ANU Guntur.

faqs.question: What is the entrance exam of Acharya Nagarjuna University?
faqs.answer: Ans.Acharya Nagarjuna University conducts an Acharya Nagarjuna University Post Graduate Common Entrance Test (ANU PGCET) to offer admission to PG programs. Admission to MBA and MCA is based on AP ICET scores. To give admission in B.Tech + M.Tech, B.Des and B.Plan the university conducts anANU Engineering Entrance Test (ANUEET).

faqs.question: What is the ranking of Acharya Nagarjuna University?
faqs.answer: Ans.Acharya Nagarjuna University is ranked63rdin the Pharmacy Category by NIRF Ranking 2023. The National Assessment and Accreditation Council (NAAC) awarded Acharya Nagarjuna University an “A” grade.

faqs.question: What entrance exams are accepted by Acharya Nagarjuna University?
faqs.answer: Ans.Admission to B.Tech programs at Acharya Nagarjuna University is based on JEE Mains and AP EAPCET scores. The university also accepts merit in AP EAPCET for B.Sc. and B.Pharma. Admission to the B.Arch. program is granted solely based on the candidate’s performance in NATA.

Section.name: About ANU
Section.description:
Acharya Nagarjuna University was established in 1976 by the former President of India, Shri Fakruddin Ali Ahmed in Guntur, Andhra Pradesh. The university offers 68 undergraduate and postgraduate courses in the fields of Engineering, Sciences, Arts, Pharmacy, Sports and Architecture. It also provides M.Phil and Ph.D in 48 disciplines spread over six campus colleges. It has 450 affiliated colleges in Krishna, Guntur and Prakasm Districts. The National Assessment and Accreditation Council (NAAC) awarded Acharya Nagarjuna University an “A” grade. It is spread over an area of 300 acres. There are 5000 students enrolled in the university. Acharya Nagarjuna University is ranked 63rd in the Pharmacy Category by NIRF Ranking 2023. The university is focused on research with 66 patents, 200+ projects and more than 15000 research publications. The institute also offers distance education through ANUCDE.

Acharya Nagarjuna University Admission 2024 is merit-based. Admission to B.Tech programs is based on JEE Mains and AP EAPCET scores. The university also accepts merit in AP EAPCET for B.Sc. and B.Pharma. Admission to the B.Arch. program is granted solely based on the candidate’s performance in NATA. To give admission in B.Tech + M.Tech, B.Des and B.Plan the university conducts an ANU Engineering Entrance Test (ANUEET). Admission to all the other UG courses is done based on merit secured in the last qualifying exams. For the PG courses, the institute conducts an Acharya Nagarjuna University Post Graduate Common Entrance Test (ANUPGCET). Admission to MBA and MCA is based on AP ICET. Interested students must visit the official website to apply for Acharya Nagarjuna University Admission.

It is an affiliating university with 39 academic departments. The university has two PG centres located at Ongole (a fully self-financed centre) and another at Nuzvid (aided).
Ques. How are the faculties of Acharya Nagarjuna University?
Ans. The faculties of Acharya Nagarjuna University are highly educated and qualified to have diverse industry experience. Each subject department has a HOD and faculties have the designation of Assistant Professor with teaching/ industry experience of more than 10 years.

The median salary offered to UG students was in a range of INR 3 LPA to INR 8 LPA and PG students were given a median package ranging from INR 3.5 LPA to INR 6.5 LPA.
Ques. What courses are offered by Acharya Nagarjuna University?
Ans. Acharya Nagarjuna University offers 68 undergraduate and postgraduate courses in the fields of Engineering, Sciences, Arts, Pharmacy, Sports and Architecture. It also provides M.Phil and Ph.D in 48 disciplines spread over six campus colleges. Some of the popular programs of ANU Guntur include B.Tech, MBA, M.Tech, PG Diploma, B.Pharm and M.Pharm.

Ans. Acharya Nagarjuna University accepts AP ICET scores to offer admission to MBA and MCA programs. The overall cutoff rank for APICET is 3151 for MCA and 5247 for MBA at ANU Guntur.
Ques. What is the entrance exam of Acharya Nagarjuna University?
Ans. Acharya Nagarjuna University conducts an Acharya Nagarjuna University Post Graduate Common Entrance Test (ANU PGCET) to offer admission to PG programs. Admission to MBA and MCA is based on AP ICET scores. To give admission in B.Tech + M.Tech, B.Des and B.Plan the university conducts an ANU Engineering Entrance Test (ANUEET).

Ques. What entrance exams are accepted by Acharya Nagarjuna University?
Ans. Admission to B.Tech programs at Acharya Nagarjuna University is based on JEE Mains and AP EAPCET scores. The university also accepts merit in AP EAPCET for B.Sc. and B.Pharma. Admission to the B.Arch. program is granted solely based on the candidate’s performance in NATA.
